Hy guys, i'm from Brasil, very nice videos. Witch is the firts video of SV

top_comment.author: HAROLDO FIOCCO

comments.text: S\V Delos- Pacific Crossing Mexico to Marquesas, Part 1
comments.author: SV Delos Crew
SV Delos Crew

top_comment.text:
Josje is back on the scene! Join the S\V Delos crew as we sail from Fitzroy 
Island to Milln Reef for some sweet diving. It's then back to Cairns to get 
our NEW dinghy and do a big shop in preparation for the 1,300 mile sail 
North to Darwin.﻿
top_comment.author: SV Delos Crew

comments.text: Talking about off the grid. This is Heaven on earth
comments.author: michaelnew1962

comments.text: Tell us about the new dingy specs Brian?
comments.author: Thomas K

top_comment.text:
Awesome videos and even better story-line editing guys; I’m not sure who 
the artist is but I’m a fan. Are there compositions in the sketch book 
other than mapping? A stellar boat on adventure with an almost perfect 
crew… Fresh winds…﻿
top_comment.author: zootart1

comments.text:
+Brian SV Delos
The time-lapse used with Phoebe’s art skills indeed are very cool. I just 
re-read my post to you and realized a gaffe; I meant no disrespect to your 
crew; you guys seem perfectly matched. I meant to say, it would be a 
‘perfect crew’ if I were a member on your stellar boat, but it didn’t come 
out that way. I’m digressing… my compliments to Phoebe for her compositions 
and to you and your crew for living the dream… fresh winds… Looking forward 
to more drawings and adventures.
comments.author: zootart1

comments.text:
Thanks for the comment!  The artist is Phoebe, Josje's sister.  She felt 
inspired while sailing and started doing drawings for the videos which 
turned out pretty cool in time-lapse.  Cheers- Delos
comments.author: SV Delos Crew

captions.text:
"How are you feeling Andrew?"
"Arghhh.. pretty hungover!"

(laughs)
"Bit of a headache.."

"Nothing that some sunshine won't fix!"
"Sweet!"

After a few days of sun and fun
on Fitzroy island

we picked up the hook and set
sail again. We were headed
further East.

to Milln Reef, which is on the
very outer edge of the Great
Barrier Reef.

The sailing conditions were
absolutely perfect
and Delos made an easy 6 knots.

It was a good first sail for
Andrew to nurse that hangover.

"We are approaching Milln
Reef.."

"On the outer Reef just outside
of Cairns,

...we're about 25-26 miles off
shore"

"Had a pretty good little sail
here!"

"Just looking to pick up this
ahhh..

"But I think it's gonna be fun!"
"Yeah, it's a beautiful day!"
"Very important procedure!"

The coral at Milln was better
than most spots

we'd seen on the Great Barrier
Reef. It was refreshing to see
live, healthy coral!

But what really makes these
remote reefs special is the
abundance of animal life.

Within just a few minutes time
we spotted this massive lobster

a sweet little black tip reef
shark

and this guy who wasn't
bothered by us in the slightest!
"Gorgeous!"
"It was really cool!"

We had a new dinghy waiting for
us back in Cairns, and a major
provisioning run to do

before continuing on so it was
back to the mainland one last
time.

With good breeze and the sails
trimmed

we made a short trip of it and
arrived just in time to receive
our new dinghy we'd been
waiting so long for!
"WOOOOW"

"What do you think Brady?"
"She's a beast bro!"

"A BEAST!"
"She's a beast!"
"MILK!"

The stores are few and far
between in northern-most
Queensland

and the in the Northern
Territory so we provisioned for
a month

just enough to get us to Darwin.
"Instead of getting this tofu..
I found this one..

..doesn't even need a refrigerator"
"Sweet"
"Yeah!"
"Oh instant noodle!"
"Alright number one.."
"Cart number 2.. cart number 3"

"What's your guess Josje?"
"Ohhhhh..."
"782"
"735"

"I'm gonna go with 599"
"And Brady?"
"I'm gonna do...
"Ahh, I don't know.."

Josje was the best guesser at
$772.00!

A big shop while cruising is
always an adventure.

Pushing loaded trolley's
through town and down the dock
to the dinghy is just part of a
day's work.
Then the fun really begins!

At least we have our new
super-dinghy to help out!

With all our provisions stowed
Delos was finally ready to
begin our cruise north.

We had about 1,300 nautical
miles to cover before reaching
Darwin,

and about a month to do it in!
Time to go sailing!
"Alright anchor's up!"

Up next! The crew sails to
Darwin
feasts on sushi

and gives Delos a good
scrubbing.
